$HYPE   had a decent setup inverse head & shoulders plus an ascending triangle  but the lack of volume was the red flag. Once volume kicked in, price dumped hard, breaking below 26.846 and hitting $26.043.  That move wiped out both bullish structures. The iH&S is gone, the triangle's invalid, and there's nothing bullish left on the chart. At this point, the only level that matters is a daily close above $27.5. Without that, there‚Äôs no range, no base, and no setup to work with.  Until then, the chart‚Äôs got no structure and with no structure, there‚Äôs no trade. No edge, no interest. Key Details:    ‚Äî Assistance Fund holds ~$1B in HYPE (approx. 37M tokens) from automated fee conversions   ‚Äî Fund address designed with no control keys ‚Äì tokens already irretrievable without hard fork   ‚Äî 'Yes' vote treats these as effectively burned via social consensus   ‚Äî Aligns supply metrics with original intent: fees buy back HYPE but lock it forever   ‚Äî Future contributions (e.g., 50% of USDH reserve yields) would also be recognized as burned    This clarifies token economics amid rising institutional interest, without on-chain changes.    HYPE holders benefit from reduced ambiguity on effective supply.    This is not financial advice. Always DYOR.    #Hyperliquid  #HYPE  #Crypto  #Governance  #DeFi

GM $HYPE and CMC fam!
Recently called out the fake burn hype around
$HYPE
This whole narrative was pushed to avoid liquidating a major dev's ~$60M long position and to bail out another insider who was deep underwater‚Äîhe dumped his bags right after the pump for quick profits.
Plus, the pump feels manufactured because those "burned" tokens in the Assistance Fund aren't even in circulation yet.
Formalizing them as burned changes nothing on real supply it's more optics than impact.
Now heading into the vote, two likely scenarios:
They pump hard pre-vote, get it approved, then dump on the community to lock in gains.
1765976755.4932961
They rally bots/hundreds of coordinated accounts to vote NO, triggering a post-pump liquidation cascade.

Either way, it screams exit liquidity. That's why I'm shorting $HYPE here around $27.4. Always manage risk, this market eats overleveraged positions alive. DYOR/NFA.

Supply shock on the table.

Hyperliquid is weighing a proposal to burn 37.1M tokens held in its Assistance Fund, roughly 13% of circulating supply removed for good.

The market read it as a credibility move.
Less excess supply.
Cleaner FDV optics.
Clearer price discovery.

After the announcement,   $HYPEpushed toward the mid $26 range as open interest ticked higher, hinting traders are repositioning rather than fading the move.

If approved, analysts are already nudging end of year targets higher, with upside scenarios expanding into 2026 as supply assumptions reset.

Governance now matters.
Validator signals by Dec 21.
Final stake alignment by Dec 24.

If this burn passes,  $HYPE stops carrying dead weight and starts trading more like a scarce asset than an overhang risk.

#Macro Insights# #Altcoin Season#
I'm bearish on $HYPE   & ON ALL THE MARKET  i am frontrunning the bearish mindshare

the proposal basically treats ~37m $HYPE  sitting in the assistance fund as gone for good. not paused. not locked. effectively removed from supply. that‚Äôs roughly 10% of circulating supply and almost 4% of total, tied directly to fees the protocol already generated.  these tokens were never realistically spendable anyway. the vote just makes the supply math honest. cleaner supply. less ambiguity. institutions actually care about that stuff.  add on top that hyperliquid already routes almost all fees into buy pressure, with base and priority fees burned at the chain level, and you end up with something rare  real usage, real revenue, real supply compression  does it magically moon overnight no. but it quietly tightens the float while volume stays insane. this changes $HYPE  from narrative driven to structurally scarce. i‚Äôm looking at 1.7x to 2x from here if market conditions don‚Äôt break.

üî• Hyperliquid's 37M $HYPE  Burn: Game Changer or Clever Move?  Hyperliquid is putting nearly $1 billion worth of $HYPE  tokens under the spotlight. The Hyper Foundation has proposed a validator vote to formally recognize 37M HYPE tokens held in the protocol's Assistance Fund as burned - effectively removing them from circulation.   üîí These tokens were already inaccessible, locked in an address with no private key. If approved, they will never re-enter circulation, reducing any confusion around HYPE‚Äôs effective supply. With $874M in fees generated this year and most of those routed into HYPE repurchase, this move aligns the protocol‚Äôs supply reporting with its actual mechanics.   üìä Validators will vote by December 21, with the final decision made by stake-weighted consensus. Will this burn impact your HYPE price target?  Let‚Äôs see what the market thinks!  Spotters, do you think this burn will push HYPE higher, or is it just a clever accounting move? #HyperLiquid  #Altcoin Season#  #HYPE

üö® $1 BILLION HYPE TOKENS COULD BE BURNED  Hyperliquid wants validators to vote on burning nearly $1B in $HYPE  tokens from the Assistance Fund.  The vote runs through Dec. 24 and could remove over 10% of HYPE from circulating and total supply.  #Gemini  #Altcoin Season#

Burning 37M HYPE isn‚Äôt a cosmetic tweak it‚Äôs one of the biggest supply adjustments in Hyperliquid‚Äôs history and a potential turning point for the token‚Äôs outlook. The proposal would formally treat all HYPE held in the Assistance Fund as permanently out of both circulating and total supply, removing about 13% of HYPE if validators approve it.  Ôøº  What makes this meaningful is two-fold. First, supply reduction creates scarcity, a classic mechanism to support valuation if demand holds or grows. That‚Äôs why HYPE ticked up on announcement and why open interest and funding rates in derivatives have responded positively.  Ôøº  Second, this is governance in action. It‚Äôs not just burning tokens; it‚Äôs a signal about how seriously the community views structural tokenomics over short-term unlock pressure. Critics have noted that prior unlocks and dilution weighed on price this proposal directly counteracts that.  Ôøº  So how does this shape your $HYPE  target? If the burn passes and stays credible, it tilts the narrative bullishly because less supply plus sustained fee-driven buybacks = stronger fundamentals. But this isn‚Äôt a guaranteed rocket: the vote still needs validator backing, and execution relies on community alignment.  In short: this proposal could bump HYPE targets higher, not because of hype alone, but because it meaningfully tightens supply and signals long-term economic discipline.  #Altcoin Season#  #Macro Insights#  #Meme Alpha#

$HYPE  Hyperliquid has acquired a strong user basis of perp traders which led to an impressive rise to 58$ (+846%) since token launch. However, after its #ATH  on Sep 18th 2025, it has lost -53% of its value, hovering around the support zone of 26$. Given HYPE is not inflationary since it has a supply cap and most coins already minted, the announced token #burn  should lead to a reduction in #supply  and thus likely a price appreciation. Of course, this can be overpowered by short-term market #momentum  and #sentiment .

üí• Hyperliquid's Bold Move: The HYPE Token Burn Proposal  The Hyper Foundation has proposed burning all $HYPE  tokens in the Assistance Fund, which would reduce both the circulating and total supply. If validators agree, this move could trigger a price recovery for HYPE, which has dropped over 50% in the last few months.  The Assistance Fund automatically converts trading fees into HYPE tokens, but these tokens are locked away in a special system address with no access, unless a hard fork is executed. Hyperliquid‚Äôs 37 M Token Burn Proposal ‚Äî Key Implications

The Hyperliquid ecosystem is currently undergoing its most significant evolution since the mainnet launch. The Hyper Foundation has officially opened the validator vote to permanently burn 37.11 million  $HYPE tokens currently held in the Assistance Fund. While the market often views burns as simple "hype" events, this specific proposal represents a fundamental shift from discretionary fund management to pure algorithmic scarcity.
‚Äã1. Establishing Permanent Social Consensus
‚ÄãThe tokens in question are already held in a system address with no private key, making them mathematically inaccessible under current conditions. However, this vote is about something much deeper than a wallet balance. By passing this proposal, the community and validators are establishing a binding social consensus that no future protocol upgrade or hard fork will ever be used to retrieve these funds. This effectively deletes roughly 13% of the circulating supply and 3.7% of the total supply from the project's future forever.
‚Äã2. The Death of the "High FDV" Narrative
‚ÄãOne of the primary criticisms of high-performance Layer 1 and DeFi protocols is a bloated Fully Diluted Valuation (FDV) that scares away long-term institutional investors. At current market prices, this burn permanently removes nearly $1 billion in value from the FDV. By slashing the "shadow supply" sitting in the Assistance Fund, Hyperliquid is making its valuation framework significantly more transparent and attractive to major players like Bitwise and Cantor Fitzgerald, who are already tracking the protocol‚Äôs massive $874M+ year-to-date fee revenue.
‚Äã3. Strategic Transition to Autonomy
‚ÄãThe "Assistance Fund. 
Burning these tokens signals to the world that the protocol is now self-sustaining. The revenue generated by trading fees is now fueling a leaner, more efficient economic machine where the value accrues directly to the remaining holders rather than sitting in a foundation reserve.

üî•Burning 37M tokens is not a cosmetic move; it materially changes how the market should think about  $HYPE going forward. 

Removing roughly 13% of supply from both circulating and total countsü§î, tightens the float and directly alters scarcity dynamics. 

üí°If demand stays flat or improves, fewer tokens are now competing for the same capital, which explains the immediate reaction in price, open interest, and funding rates.

More importantlyüßê, this signals governance maturity. 

üìäChoosing to permanently retire tokens from the Assistance Fund shows a preference for long-term structural healthüöÄ over short-term flexibility. 

üö®For valuation, the focus shifts from future dilution risk to sustainability: liquidity conditions, protocol usage, and whether reduced supply #HYPE translates into steadier price discovery rather than sharp speculative spikes.
